Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y and NIH3T3 cells were cultured and treated with hydrogen peroxide.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (L166P) showed minimal pI shift to acidic points compared to wild-type DJ-1 after hydrogen peroxide treatment, indicating loss of antioxidative activity.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for pI shift and antioxidative activity.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant pI shift to acidic point (from 6.7 to 5.7) after hydrogen peroxide treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Minimal or no pI shift to acidic point after hydrogen peroxide treatment.

Material used.Description: Recombinant DJ-1 was expressed in and purified from Escherichia coli.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (L166P) showed significantly reduced ability to eliminate hydrogen peroxide compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for hydrogen peroxide elimination.

Basic negative control.Description: Bovine serum albumin (BSA) was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Elimination of approximately 80% of hydrogen peroxide in the reaction mixture.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Elimination of less than 20% of hydrogen peroxide in the reaction mixture.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y and NIH3T3 cells were treated with hydrogen peroxide, MPP+, or 6-OHDA.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells harboring L166P mutant DJ-1 were most sensitive to hydrogen peroxide-induced cell death compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells with wild-type DJ-1 were used as a positive control for resistance to hydrogen peroxide-induced cell death.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with control vector or parental non-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to or higher than wild-type DJ-1 transfected cells after hydrogen peroxide treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability significantly lower than wild-type DJ-1 transfected cells, similar to or lower than control vector transfected cells after hydrogen peroxide treatment.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transfected with plasmids for wild-type or mutant DJ-1 and treated with hydrogen peroxide.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells transfected with L166P mutant DJ-1 showed fluorescence intensity similar to control vector, indicating no elimination of hydrogen peroxide.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells transfected with wild-type DJ-1 showed reduced fluorescence intensity, indicating hydrogen peroxide elimination.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with control vector showed high fluorescence intensity, indicating no hydrogen peroxide elimination.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Reduced fluorescence intensity compared to control vector, indicating hydrogen peroxide elimination.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity similar to control vector, indicating no hydrogen peroxide elimination.
